section.title: Runtime parameters
section.para: Implementations may provide mechanisms for defining name/value pairs at runtime. The p:param function provides access to those values. Runtime values accessed in this way are independent of pipeline options which may also be defined in an implementation-defined manner.

Unlike pipeline options, the values accessable through p:param are global in scope. That is, a pipeline nested inside a library, to which thereâ€™s no way to pass an option directly, may obtain a default value from the runtime environment with p:param. This provides a useful mechanism for passing configuration details, for example serialization parameters, into the system at runtime.
If a runtime value has been provided for $name, it is returned, otherwise $default is returned.

If $as is provided, it must be an XPath sequence type. It is a dynamic error if the parameter sequence type is not syntactically valid. The sequence type item()* is assumed if no explicit type is provided.

If a type is provided, the value returned is converted to the required type, using the function conversion rules specified by XPath 3.1. It is a dynamic error if the value cannot be converted to the required type.
The value of the p:param function during static analysis is the empty sequence for all names.
